page.title: 05CULLODEN HOUSE (HISTORY)
page.content: The land on which Culloden House stands ,was originally owned by the chief of the Mackintosh clan,Mackintosh of Mackintosh. In 1626 the land came into the hands of the Forbes family who commissioned the building of Culloden House as their family seat around the middle of the 17th century.Culloden House was built in the Adam style.Duncan Forbes was the most famous person in his family.He had been the town lawyer, a MP of Inverness and from being MP of Inverness he became Lord Advocate. In 1737 Duncan Forbes became Lord President of the Court which was very high up.The local school that is near by to Culloden House is named after him.
